Improve My Relationship with My Teen.module_name: Spending One-on-One Time with My Teen
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about spending one-on-one time with Your Teen. üòÉ
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.importance.msg_list: Spending one-on-one time with Your Teen will help you build trust, respect, and a positive relationship between you and Your Teen.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: When I spend special time with my teen, I need to decide what we will do together.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
üéâ You are right! 

üö≤Your teen can choose the activity as long as it is safe. This will increase their confidence and make it more likely that they enjoy their time with you.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
üëÄ Oops! Good Try!

üö≤ You do not have to plan an activity. Your teen can lead! Let them choose as long as it is safe. This will increase their confidence and make it more likely that they enjoy their time with you.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.intro: Let‚Äôs see how {F1_FATHER} and {F1_DAUGHTER_13} spend one-on-one time together:
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.1:
**{F1_FATHER}**: ‚Äú{F1_DAUGHTER_13}, how was your day?‚Äù

**{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúMy day was good, {F1_FATHER}. I just came from school.‚Äù
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.2:
**{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúI have 5 minutes of one-on-one time to spare before I have to drive to work again. What would you like to do together?‚Äù

**{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúI was about to do my Science homework. The topic for the homework is to make something out of recycled materials. Could you please help me with it?‚Äù

**{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúI would be happy to!‚Äù
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.3:
**{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúI thought of building a recycled house using old bottles, boxes, and other recycled materials. Look! I picked these up on my way home. They were thrown away by the side of the road and outside the spaza shops.‚Äù

**{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúWhat a good idea, {F1_DAUGHTER_13}! Sounds like you‚Äôve thought about this a lot and want to put a lot of effort into your homework. How do you want me to help you?‚Äù
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.4:
**{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúCould you help me clean these bottles? They will be the pillars of the house. I will make the boxes into the walls and roof of the house. Later, I thought we could paint the boxes and bottles so they look beautiful.‚Äù

**{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúI may have some leftover paint outside the house. I can take a look later.‚Äù
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.5:
(Later in the day) 

**{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúWow, it looks different now! It does not look like you used rubbish at all anymore. You also painted the walls and the roof beautifully! I think your teacher will be proud of you when she sees your homework!‚Äù

**{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúThank you for your help, {F1_FATHER}. You know, there were a lot of fun things that happened in school today.‚Äù 

**{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúGo ahead, tell me!‚Äù
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.intro: Here are 3Ô∏è‚É£tips to remember to help you make the most of spending one-on-one time with Your Teen: DAY, PLAY, and STAY.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *DAY - Try to do it every day*

‚è∞ Spend 5 minutes (or more!) with Your Teen each day.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *PLAY - Let them choose the activity*

‚è∞ Ask to spend time with Your Teen.

‚öΩ Let them choose what to do or talk about.

üéàTry different activities together.

üòÉ Have fun!
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *STAY - Focus on your teen*

üì∫ Switch off the TV, put aside phones and remove distractions.

üëÄ Look at Your Teen. Nod or say ‚ÄúI see‚Äù to show you are really paying attention.
 
üíõ Accept your teen and avoid judgement.
 
üëÇ Repeat in your own words what your teen says. It shows you are really listening to them.

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.importance.msg_list:
Praising Your Teen when they behave well will make them want to behave that way more often. 

It also creates a positive and loving relationship between you and your teen. ‚≠ê

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: The way you praise Your Teen does not matter because any kind of praise is effective.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
üéâ You are right! 

‚ú® How you praise your teen is important. Praise should be specific, immediate, and genuine. 

üå± You can begin by praising your teen for the smallest things, such as putting away their clothes after school.

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.intro:
When you bring attention to good behaviours, your teen is likely to behave well more often and feel good about themselves!

Here are 4Ô∏è‚É£ simple tips for praising Your Teen:
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *SEE IT*

üëÄ Look for anything good or helpful that Your Teen does.

‚è∏ Pause and really notice when they are doing something positive.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *SAY IT*

üèÜ Praise them when you see them do something you like.

‚úÖ Tell them specifically what they have done well.

üéâ Be enthusiastic and really mean it!

üîÑ This way, they are more likely to do it again.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *REPEAT IT*

üå∑ Look for something to praise Your Teen for every day.

üî∂ Even if it is something really small, keep doing it.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ *KEEP IT POSITIVE*

üí° Make sure you focus on something Your Teen has done well.

üôÇYou can show your praise with a big smile and words. You can also raise your thumb, hug, or wink an eye at Your Teen to show you appreciate them.

üåà Keeping it positive reminds your teen that you notice them and care.

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.module_name: Creating a Routine for One-on-One Time
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about creating routines for spending one-on-one time with Your Teen. üîÑ
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.importance.msg_list:
To continue building a positive relationship with Your Teen, let‚Äôs make one-on-one time a part of a routine. You can use the tips in this lesson to create other daily routines with Your Teen. 

Creating other daily routines with Your Teen will help them feel more calm and connected with you and behave better.  üîë Help them plan time for resting, meals, chores, school, and sleep. ‚è∞
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.intro: Here is a comic about how you can create a routine for spending one-on-one time with Your Teen:
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.1:
**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: ‚Äú{F2_SON_15}, I really enjoyed spending one-on-one time with you yesterday. I never knew you were so good at soccer!‚Äù

**{F2_SON_15}**: ‚ÄúAw‚Ä¶thanks, {F2_GRANDFATHER}!‚Äù
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.2:
**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: ‚ÄúIt would be great if we could have time together more often. Should we try to do it every day?‚Äù

**{F2_SON_15}**: ‚ÄúI guess so‚Ä¶though sometimes I am busy.‚Äù
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.3:
**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: ‚ÄúYeah, that‚Äôs true. Let‚Äôs make it something that we can really do. I am sure we could find 15 minutes together!‚Äù

**{F2_SON_15}**: ‚ÄúSure, we can try.‚Äù

**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: ‚ÄúWhen would be the best time for you?‚Äù
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.4:
**{F2_SON_15}**: ‚ÄúHow about after dinner?‚Äù

**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: ‚ÄúThat could work as long as we clean up first. Let‚Äôs start today. And remember, you can choose what we do!‚Äù
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.5:
**{F2_SON_15}**: ‚ÄúOkay, {F2_GRANDFATHER}. I look forward to it.‚Äù

**{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: ‚ÄúThanks, {F2_SON_15}. I really appreciate having this time with you. It means a lot to me.‚Äù
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.intro: Here are some tips on how to create routines with Your Teen:
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ BE A TEAM

‚òï Talk to Your Teen about what they want their routines to look like.

‚ú® Your Teen is more likely to follow routines when they help to create them.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ BE CONSISTENT

üëÄ Make sure Your Teen follows their routines daily.

üíô This helps your teen feel secure, calm and connected to you because they know what to expect.

üå± Feeling secure means Your Teen has space to grow, develop and gain independence.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ PRAISE, PRAISE, PRAISE

üéà Praise Your Teen for creating a routine with you.

üåà Praise Your Teen when they stick to it.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.4.text:
Here are some other routines you could create with Your Teen in addition to One-on-One Time:

‚úÖ Bedtime
‚úÖ Homework
‚úÖ Chores
‚úÖ Mealtime
‚úÖ Free time
‚úÖ T.V. or phone time

You can also make other routines with your teen like having a meal together or going for a walk. It will help your teen feel connected to you and loved.

Or instead of 15 minutes a day, try 5 minutes. You can also ask your teen for ideas on which routines could be useful for your teen. They might surprise you!

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about noticing your and Your Teen‚Äôs feelings during one-on-one time.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.importance.msg_list:
Noticing and talking about feelings with Your Teens will help them learn how to express themselves. 

üëåThey will learn that all feelings are okay - even the difficult ones.
 
üå∑ You can help by listening to them, thinking about how it must feel for them, and accepting their emotions. 

ü§óThis will help them recognise other people‚Äôs feelings, too.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: Talking about happy feelings is not as important as sharing difficult feelings.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct: üéâ That‚Äôs correct. There are 6 basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid. It‚Äôs important that we talk with our teens about ALL of them.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect: üëÄOops! Good Try! There are 6 basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid. It‚Äôs important that we talk with our teens about ALL of them.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.2.question: Here‚Äôs another one: Boys should not share when they are feeling sad or afraid.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct: üéâ You are right! It is important that both boys and girls learn how to communicate about all of their feelings. Boys will learn that it is okay to feel upset or sad about something and that it is okay to ask for help when they need it.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect: üëÄ Oops! Good Try! It is important that both boys and girls learn how to communicate about all their feelings. Boys will learn that it is okay to feel upset or sad about something and that it is okay to ask for help when they need it. This is important for girls, too!
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.3.question: Last one: As parents, we can also share our feelings with our teens.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct: üéâ Correct! Sharing our feelings with our teens in a calm way shows them how to do the same with their own feelings.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect: üëÄ Oops! Good Try! Sharing our feelings with our teens in a calm way shows them how to do the same with their own feelings.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.intro: Here is a comic about how you can talk about feelings with your teen during one-on-one time.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.1: {F1_FATHER} and {F1_DAUGHTER_16} are spending one-on-one time by taking a walk together. {F1_DAUGHTER_16} looks very upset.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.2:
**{F1_FATHER}**: ‚Äú{F1_DAUGHTER_16}, I noticed you have less energy today and you look sad. Do you want to talk about it?‚Äù 
**{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: ‚ÄúOh, {F1_FATHER}. I studied so hard for my maths test and failed. I feel so sad and frustrated.‚Äù
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.3:
**{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúThat is frustrating, my girl. I know how hard you studied. Maybe we can come up with a new plan to help you with maths. Should we ask your teacher for extra help? Would you like me to talk to her or do you want to do it?‚Äù 

**{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: ‚ÄúThank you, {F1_FATHER}. I can do it! I think that might be a good idea.‚Äù
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.comic.text.4: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúYou know, maths may be difficult for you, but I am so proud of you for studying so hard, {F1_DAUGHTER_16}. Other people might give up, but you keep trying. That will help you so much in life!‚Äù
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.intro: Here are 6Ô∏è‚É£ tips for how you can help Your Teen learn how to cope with their emotions: LEARN, NOTICE, OPEN, TALK, SHARE and CARE
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ LEARN

üí° Learn about different emotions. There are 6 basic emotions that each send us a very specific message:

üòÉHappy: Keep doing things that make you feel good.

üòîSad: Something important in your life needs attention.

üî¥Angry: Stand up for ourselves and set limits.

üò£Disgusted: Move away from what we don't like.

üëÄSurprised: Stop and pay attention for a moment.

üö©Afraid: Run away from danger.

üé® As teens, they learn to identify lots of other emotions, like feeling excited, frustrated, proud, lonely, peaceful, guilty, or confused.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ NOTICE

üëÄ Begin observing these 6 emotions in yourself and in Your Teen.

üòÉüòíüòîüò£ Notice how each emotion feels in your body.
 
üòÉ You can also notice positive emotions such as a sense of peace, happiness, or calmness.

üíô Noticing can also help your teen to appreciate a beautiful moment or feeling of love!
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ OPEN

Be open, notice üëÄ, and listen üëÇ to Your Teen when they share how they are feeling. 
üíõ Accept how you and Your Teen feel. Remember, your body and their body are sending messages about what you both are feeling, and those messages are important.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ TALK

üòí It is normal to struggle to talk about and express emotions and feelings. 

üìù Remember, it is also normal to experience feelings in different ways.

‚≠ê When Your Teen is feeling an emotion, describe what you are observing in a calm way. 
For example, 

‚ÄúI notice you slammed the door, talk loudly, and your face looks a bit upset. Are you feeling angry because you can‚Äôt go out at night?‚Äù

You can also help Your Teen manage different emotions by encouraging them to share how they feel and supporting them.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.5.text:
5Ô∏è‚É£ SHARE

üòÉ Share your own feelings with Your Teen. 

For example, ‚ÄúI would feel the same way if I couldn‚Äôt go out when I wanted to‚Äù. 

 üéàThis sets a good example and shows Your Teen that it's okay to share their own feelings.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.6.text:
6Ô∏è‚É£ CARE

üå∑ Use actions and words to make Your Teen feel accepted and loved. 

‚≠ê Do some active exercise to shake out anger, give each other some space, or take some deep breaths to calm down. These are some ways to deal with your emotions. 

üíö Remind Your Teen that you are there for them and that they can always talk to you.

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.module_name: Keeping Calm When We Are Stressed
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about how we can keep calm and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments with our teens. üíö
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.importance.msg_list:
As you began noticing feelings, you would have noticed feelings of anger, frustration or sadness. 

üå∑ We love our teens, but stress from caregiving and other events can make us feel angry. This is a normal part of life! 

üí° It is important for us to stay in control and manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: When I am angry at my teen, I should show that I am angry so that they stop misbehaving.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
üéâ That‚Äôs correct! 

üíõ It can be very difficult when your teen is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your own anger before doing anything. 

üå± Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
üëÄ Oops! Good Try!

üíõ It can be very difficult when your teen is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your own anger before doing anything. 

üå± Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.

Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.intro: There are 4Ô∏è‚É£ steps to keeping calm in stressful situations: BE CALM, QUICK, CLEAR, and POSITIVE.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *BE CALM*

‚úÖ Be aware of your own feelings.

‚úÖTake a pause or a few breaths before asking Your Teen to do something else.

‚úÖ Speak with Your Teen in a calm voice.

‚úÖ Remember your goal: Make Your Teen feel loved and connected to you.
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *BE QUICK*

‚è∞ There are other things you can do to help manage unwanted behaviour before it becomes stressful. 

‚ú® Praise something positive that your teen did today. 

‚ú® Understand their feelings. For example, it may feel boring to clean up after having fun or ending a big task. 

‚ú® When you see Your Teen is about to start unwanted behaviour, distract them by asking them to do something else, before the unwanted behaviour begins or gets worse. 

‚ú® Invite Your Teen in a chore you are doing. You can ask Your Teen to think of a fun and quick way of doing the chores differently. 

üí° Preventing unwanted behaviour is much easier than disciplining them after they have done something wrong!
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *BE CLEAR*

‚úÖ Rather than saying what you DON‚ÄôT want, tell Your Teen what you DO want them to do.

For example, say:

‚ú® ‚ÄúPlease speak more softly.‚Äù instead of ‚ÄúStop shouting!‚Äù

‚ú® ‚ÄúRemember to hang your jacket in your closet, please.‚Äù 
instead of ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt leave your jacket on the floor!‚Äù

This way, it is easier for them to follow! ‚≠ê
Improve My Relationship with My Teen.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ *BE POSITIVE*

‚úÖ Praise Your Teen when they behave well!

‚úÖ Invite Your Teen to a positive activity when you see they are about to start an unwanted behaviour.

‚úÖ It will also help them know what you expect from them!

Keep My Teen Safe.tips.intro:
One way to keep your teen safe is to create a safety map with them. Together, identify the safe and unsafe places in your community. üìñ

Here are 3Ô∏è‚É£three steps to help you make a safety map together:
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.1.text:
Step 1Ô∏è‚É£: **DRAW**

üìù Draw a map of your community.

üö© Include the main places: streets, your house, school, shops, and places your teen visits.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.2.text:
Step 2Ô∏è‚É£: **DECIDE**

üîë Talk about the places on your map and decide if they are safe or not.

üëÇ Listen to your teen: they might know more than you think they do about where it is safe or unsafe.

üîµ CIRCLE the places that are safe for teenagers.

‚ùå CROSS OFF any places that are unsafe for teenagers.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.3.text:
Step 3Ô∏è‚É£: **DISCUSS**

‚ùó Sometimes, we find ourselves in trouble.

üëÄ Discuss where you and your teen can get support in a crisis. These places may include home, school, police station, or a clinic. 

üö© MARK these areas clearly with a ‚≠ê star on your map.

Keep My Teen Safe.introduction.msg_list: It can be hard to think about dangerous situations for your teen.
Keep My Teen Safe.importance.msg_list:
To keep our teens safe, we need to understand their reality and the potential risky situations they can find themselves in. 
We can help our teens know how to use their thoughts and voices, in dangerous situations. It makes a big difference!
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.intro: Check out these scenarios. What warning signs do you see?
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.question: Boy: Hey beautiful, why are you walking so fast! Don‚Äôt you want to come show us what is under that skirt?
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.values: The boy compliments the girl| The boy shows the girl attention| The boy acts disrespectfully
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct: That‚Äôs correct. In this case, the boy‚Äôs friend should speak up and correct his friend‚Äôs behaviour.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect: That‚Äôs incorrect. It‚Äôs okay to compliment and show attention, but it must be done respectfully.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.2.question:
Let‚Äôs try another. What are the warning signs?
;
Teacher: {F2_DAUGHTER_17}, if you want to get good grades this year, you need to stay after school when everyone is gone so I can tutor you.

{F2_DAUGHTER_17}: My friend also needs support. Can I invite her too?

Teacher: No, this will be our secret. You don‚Äôt want people to think you are stupid, right?
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.2.values: The teacher abuses his power and pressures the girl|The teacher tries to help the girl with schoolwork|The girl asks to include a friend
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.2.answer: The teacher abuses his power and pressures the girl
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct: That‚Äôs right. Schools have strict rules to keep students safe. The teacher is abusing his power and knows it's wrong ‚ùå. He has likely done this before and might do it again üîÅ. {F2_DAUGHTER_17} could try to find others with the same experience üë• to make reporting him easier üó£Ô∏è.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.intro: In a dangerous situation, we might freeze ‚ùÑÔ∏è or get angry üò° ‚Äì that‚Äôs normal. These tools can help keep you and your teen safe:**KNOW IT, SEE IT, SAY IT**
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ **KNOW IT**

Know the difference between healthy and unhealthy relationships ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ùå. If you're attacked, it‚Äôs never your fault. Do what you need to stay safe and get away ‚Äîdon't worry about what others think. You are worth defending üí™. You are strong and powerful ‚ö°.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ **SEE IT**

If someone makes you or anyone else feel uncomfortable with what they say or do, it‚Äôs never okay! We all have the right to feel safe, especially at home üè†. Trust your gut. If you feel attacked by words or actions, your goal is to get away.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ **SAY IT**

Your voice can stop many attacks.  

Be clear, confident, and direct. Use your voice, body language, and eye contact. If you don't feel safe, you can do whatever it takes to get away.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.4.text:
Using your voice can look different in different situations. You could shout "No!", call for help, act strangely to confuse the attacker, or negotiate.
Here are some things you might say or shout to avoid a tough situation:
‚ÄúI will call the police if you touch me again üöî.‚Äù
‚ÄúDo not touch my bum!‚Äù üëé
Or you might say:
‚ÄúNo lift for me, thanks! Last time I got a lift, I threw up!‚Äù ü§Æ
‚ÄúI will give you my phone if you let me go.‚Äù üì±
Think about what you would do in some of the examples we have looked at. There is no wrong answer! ‚ú®
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.5.text: If someone hurts you, remember it‚Äôs never your fault. Ask someone you trust for help ü§ù. Make sure your teen knows they can tell you anything so you can find a solution together.
Keep My Teen Safe.video.message: In a dangerous situation, we might freeze ‚ùÑÔ∏è or get angry üò° ‚Äì that‚Äôs normal. Press Play ‚ñ∂Ô∏è to learn the tools that can help keep you and your teen safe: **KNOW IT, SEE IT, SAY IT**

Keep My Teen Safe.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about learning how to respond to crises when they happen. ‚ùó
Keep My Teen Safe.importance.msg_list: When our teens share something that is very hard or upsetting to them, we need to remember to stay calm, listen, and be open so that they feel supported. üíõ
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.intro: Here is an example of supporting  your teen, even when something really bad happens.
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.1: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Shame my dear, you look really upset, do you want to tell me what happened?
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.2:
{F2_DAUGHTER_17}: It‚Äôs my Uncle, he‚Ä¶ he‚Ä¶ he touched me.

{F2_GRANDMOTHER} (thinking): Take a deep breath... What does my child need? She needs me to be calm and  comforting and to listen if she wants to talk.

{F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Come and sit down next to me. Take your time, I‚Äôm listening.
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.3:
{F2_DAUGHTER_17}: It‚Äôs true, he‚Ä¶ he‚Ä¶ made me do it! He made me have sex with him! I didn‚Äôt want to, I swear, and I even said NO, but he told me I would be in trouble.

{F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Thank you for sharing this with me. You are not in trouble. This is not your fault.
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.4:
{F2_DAUGHTER_17}: Yesterday when you went to see your friend. He just came and that‚Äôs when it happened.

{F2_GRANDMOTHER}: It‚Äôs okay, I believe you my child. This is a big thing and we will find a way to get the help we need. Where could we go for help?

{F2_DAUGHTER_17}: The clinic?
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.5:
{F2_GRANDMOTHER}: That is a great suggestion, {F2_DAUGHTER_17}, let‚Äôs go to the clinic. They will know what we can do to help you. Does that sound okay to you?

{F2_DAUGHTER_17}: Yes‚Ä¶ Okay‚Ä¶ But will you come with me?
Keep My Teen Safe.comic.text.6: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Of course I will. And {F2_DAUGHTER_17}? Remember this is not your fault. You did nothing to deserve this. I love you. We will get through this.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.intro: Here are some things you can do to support your teen when they share something difficult with you:
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ **BREATHE**: Take a pause

üå± Take a deep breath so you can respond calmly.
üíõ Ask yourself, ‚ÄúWhat does my teen need right now?‚Äù
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ **LISTEN**: Ask Your Teen what is going on

üëÇ Let your teen share with you what they need.

üëÄ Notice what they are feeling and tell them what you notice so they feel heard.

üíô Tell your teen that you are there for them and love them.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ **RESPOND**: What might help what is going on?

üî∂ You might need to help your teen talk about their feelings or redirect their focus.

‚û°Ô∏è You might need to talk about the actions that you or your teen could take to help with what has happened.

‚è∏ Now isn‚Äôt the time to talk about how to keep safe in the future. Right now, your teen needs you to be there for them with love.

‚úÖ Remember, you can always type {HELP} to ParentText and get information about resources in your community where you can get help.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ **COMFORT**: Be there for Your Teen
üå∑ It can be hard to see your teen feeling upset or confused, but there is a lot you can do to support them.
üíö They need you to accept them and comfort them when difficult things are going on.
üéà Remind your teen again that you love them, and thank them for sharing with you.

Keep My Teen Safe.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about how to keep Your Teen safe online. There is so much to share. We will cover online safety over two lessons. üì±
Keep My Teen Safe.importance.msg_list: Teens are spending a lot of time online. Being connected helps them stay positive and learn more! But there are also some risks and dangers. üö©

I know your friends look at TikTok, but with an open account there are also paedophiles who look at videos of teenagers. Paedophiles are adults who are sexually attracted to young children and teens.

Keep My Teen Safe.tips.intro:
Keeping Your Teen safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. üì±When it comes to online safety, there are four tips to keep in mind: 
LEARN, PROTECT, BUILD HABITS, and BUILD TRUST.

Today, we are learning about LEARN and PROTECT. 
The next lesson will cover BUILD HABITS and BUILD TRUST.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ **LEARN** the dangers of being online:

üö©CONTENT: Your Teen might come across harmful content or content you think is inappropriate for them, such as violence, aggressive language, or pornography.

üö© CONTACT: Adults might pretend to be teens and ask for sexual pictures or to meet with your teen through an online platform.

üö© CONDUCT: Sometimes, teens or strangers can say or do hurtful things online.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ **PROTECT** - Keep your teen safe online

‚úÖ Talk to your teen about which apps and websites are safe and which are not. Discuss why!

‚úÖ Help your teen learn how to make strong passwords to protect their devices.
‚úÖ Teach your teen that they should keep personal information private, including photos or videos of themselves. What goes online stays online!

Keep My Teen Safe.introduction.msg_list: This lesson continues our learning about keeping our teens safe online. üì±
Keep My Teen Safe.importance.msg_list:
The previous lesson taught you ways to protect your teen online using **LEARN** and **PROTECT**. 

In this lesson, we will learn how to **BUILD HABITS** and **BUILD TRUST**.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.intro: Often, our teens understand more about life online than we do, but that does not mean they know how to keep safe. Let‚Äôs test your online safety knowledge.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: If I send a picture to a friend, it will only be visible to them.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
üéâ That‚Äôs correct. 

üì± Even in an app where images are temporary, your friend can capture their screen and save your image. 

üö© Pictures are always stored online and can be accessed by hackers. 

‚ùó Remember, what goes online stays online!
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
üëÄ Oops! That‚Äôs not actually true. 

üì± Even in an app where images are temporary, your friend can capture their screen and save your image. 

üö© Pictures are always stored online and can be accessed by hackers. 

‚ùó Remember, what goes online stays online!
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.2.question: My password is strong because you have to know my home address to guess it.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
‚ú® That‚Äôs correct. 

‚ùó Most passwords are hacked because someone accesses a list of home addresses, birth dates, names or phone numbers. 

üö© You should never use these details in your password as they are easily guessed.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
üëÄ Oops! That‚Äôs not actually true. 

‚ùó Most passwords are hacked because someone accesses a list of home addresses, birth dates, names or phone numbers. 

üö© You should never use these details in your password as they are easily guessed.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.3.question: Links sent to me by my family and friends are safe to click on.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct:
üéà That‚Äôs right! 

‚ùó Your family member‚Äôs email or phone account could be hacked. 

üëÄ Always double-check a link before clicking on it to make sure you‚Äôre visiting a trusted website. 

üîë If you don‚Äôt recognise the web address, don‚Äôt click on it.
Keep My Teen Safe.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect:
üëÄ Oops! That‚Äôs not actually true. 

‚ùó Your family member‚Äôs email or phone account could be hacked. 

üëÄ Always double-check a link before clicking on it to make sure you‚Äôre visiting a trusted website. 

üîë If you don‚Äôt recognise the web address, don‚Äôt click on it.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.intro: Keeping Your Teen safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. üì± Today, we are learning how to **BUILD HABITS** and **BUILD TRUST**.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£**BUILD HABITS**

Set up safe online habits at home. 

‚ùåüì± Plan phone-free times in your house, like during meals, homework, or in bed.

‚≠ê Create rules with Your Teen about who they can chat with online. It is safest to only chat with people they already know. They should never share personal information in a chat room or with strangers.

üëÄ Before completing forms that ask for personal information, check that the web address begins with https://. Websites that begin with http:// may not be secure.

üìù Help Your Teen create strong passwords for their accounts. They should be long, not include obvious personal information like your name or birthday, and include upper and lower case letters, numbers and symbols.

‚ùó Tell Your Teen not to click on pop-ups that ask them to download or pay for anything.
Keep My Teen Safe.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ **BUILD TRUST** with your teen.

üå∑ Together, look at websites, social media, games, and apps Your Teen uses. 

üëÇ Ask questions - this helps you learn more about Your Teen‚Äôs interests!

üíô If you come across anything worrying together, talk about it with your teen. If you need support, type {HELP} after you complete today‚Äôs lesson or any other time you need extra support.  

‚úÖ Tell Your Teen that they should tell an adult if they feel scared, unsafe or upset about something online.

üö©Teach your teen that if a stranger offers gifts, like virtual coins, in exchange for photos and personal information and tells them to keep it a secret, they should tell you.

Keep My Teen Safe.home_activity.activity:
Home activity! ‚≠ê

Take these steps to keep your teen safe online:

 üìù Write down or draw the apps and websites your teen uses.

üèÖPraise your teen for how good they are at using the web!

üî¥ Talk about which sites or apps might be unsafe. Why?

üì± Together, talk about how Your Teen and their friends can use the internet more safely.

Understand Teen Development.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about taking care of yourself. üå±
Understand Teen Development.tips.intro: Here is a simple stretching and movement activity that may help you with stress:
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.1.text:
Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky. 
...
Push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you. 
...
Stretch to both sides. 
...
Stretch to the front and to the back.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.2.text:
Let your hands hang by your side. 
...
Squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears as you breathe in, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath. 
...
Release your shoulders as you relax your body.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.3.text:
Relax your arms and let them swing to the front and back. Take four deep breaths while you do this. This is good for your lower back.
...
Relax your arms and let them swing sideways, and turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.4.text: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from the ankles, remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.5.text: Now shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.6.text:
Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out. 
...
Raise and lower your arms, breathing in and out, 4 more times.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.7.text:
Take a moment to reflect on your experience. 
...
Remember that you can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need to release stress and energise your mind and body.

Understand Teen Development.module_name: Mental Changes in the Teen Years
Understand Teen Development.introduction.msg_list: In this course, we are learning about the changes teens go through as they grow up. Today, we will learn about changes happening to your teen‚Äôs mind.
Understand Teen Development.importance.msg_list: When you understand how Your Teen is changing, you can provide them with the support they might need and keep them safe.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.intro: Let‚Äôs see how much you know about the changes your teen may be experiencing as they grow older!
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.question: Which is common for teens?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.values: More Confidence|Less risk-taking|Struggling with identity and self-image|More trusting of people in charge
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct: Correct! Teens are trying to figure out who they are and what they want to be, which can be confusing and make them doubt themselves.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect: üëÄ Oops! Good Try! Teens often struggle with identity and self-image as they figure out who they are and what they want to be.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.question: How can parents help their teens cope with mood swings during adolescence?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.values: Ignore their feelings|Punish them for their emotions|Let them know their feelings are okay and be there for them|Encourage them to ignore their emotions
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.answer: Let them know their feelings are okay and be there for them
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct: You are right! Parents can help by listening to their teens, noticing their feelings, and being there for them.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. Parents can help by letting their teen know their feelings are okay and being there for them.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.question: Why is it important to have healthy communication with your teen during adolescence?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.values: It's not important. Teens need to figure things out on their own|It helps build trust and strengthens relationships|It keeps my teen from keeping secrets
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.answer: It helps build trust and strengthens relationships
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct: Correct! Communication between parents and teens is important because it helps them understand and trust each other more.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. Communication between parents and teens is important because it helps them understand and trust each other more.
Understand Teen Development.tips.intro: Here is what you need to know about Your Teen‚Äôs developing mind and how to talk with them about it.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ THE DEVELOPING MIND

üå± Your Teen‚Äôs brain hasn‚Äôt changed this fast since they were a baby. 

üö© Teens sometimes behave in risky ways as they test what is possible and allowed, especially if it is exciting or fun. 

‚ùó Teens don‚Äôt have the ability to always think ahead about how their behaviours might impact themselves or other people.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ BECOMING MORE INDEPENDENT

‚≠ê Teens are on their way to becoming adults.

üåà They are becoming better at sharing their ideas and are thinking more about long-term goals and their future.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ HOW TO SUPPORT YOUR TEEN

To support your teen:

üîë Guide their choices by balancing rules and limits with independence. 

üèÖ You can give them more freedom to make their own choices when they show they can be responsible and take responsibility for their actions.

‚ú® Be supportive, loving, and positive with your teen. This helps them feel more calm and connected with you, and they're more likely to come to you for help or advice when they need it.

Home Activity! Use one-on-one time to allow Your Teen to choose anything they would like to talk about. Listen to their experiences and avoid judgment. Notice how you feel and notice their feelings, too. Thank Your Teen for sharing with you. 

Can you do it today?

Understand Teen Development.module_name: Social Changes in the Teen Years
Understand Teen Development.introduction.msg_list: In this lesson we are continuing to learn about the changes your teen may be experiencing as they get older. Today we are exploring social changes.
Understand Teen Development.importance.msg_list: When you understand how Your Teen is growing and changing, you can help them when they face difficulties in social situations.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.intro: Let‚Äôs see how much you know about the social changes Your Teen may be experiencing:
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.question: Which of the following is a common social change that teens experience?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.values: They become less interested in spending time with friends.|They become less influenced by peer pressure.|They may feel pressure to fit in with their peers.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.answer: They may feel pressure to fit in with their peers.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct: Correct. Teens may feel pressure to fit in with their peers.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect: üëÄ Oops! Good Try! Teens may feel pressure to fit in with their peers.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.question: How can parents help their teens handle social changes?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.values: By always choosing their friends for them|By encouraging them to make their own decisions and supporting them through the consequences|By avoiding discussions about social issues
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.answer: By encouraging them to make their own decisions and supporting them through the consequences
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct: Correct. Parents can encourage their teen to make their own decisions and be there for them through consequences.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. Parents can encourage their teen to make their own decisions and be there for them through consequences.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.question: What impact can bullying have on a teen?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.values: Improved self-esteem|A sense of belonging|Low self-esteem and avoiding interaction with others
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.answer: Low self-esteem and avoiding interaction with others
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct: Correct. Bullying can make teens feel bad about themselves and become less social.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. Bullying can make teens feel bad about themselves and become less social.
Understand Teen Development.tips.intro: Here is what you need to know about Your Teen‚Äôs social life and how to talk with them about it.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ THE SOCIAL LIVES OF TEENS

‚öΩ Having friends is very important to Your Teen because it helps them learn how to be a good friend and understand other people's feelings better. This is a big part of growing up and becoming an adult.

üëÄ Your teen may want to feel like they belong with their peers and do things others think are cool. They might talk or dress like others while figuring out who they are. 

üòî Sometimes, when teens have a hard time making friends, they might be bullied by other kids.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ HOW TO SUPPORT YOUR TEEN

üé® Let Your Teen try different clothing and hairstyles and spend time with different people. Show them you accept them, just as they are. 

‚è∞ Tell Your Teen what you expect of them, but give them the freedom to make safe choices at home or outside, such as how to spend their free time.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ THE FACTS

Here are some facts to share with Your Child:

üíô Good friends look out for you, care about you, include you in activities, and treat you with respect. 

üö© A bully is someone who keeps trying to hurt others, either by making them feel bad or using their strength to be mean. 

üåà To stop bullying in school, it's important to be kind and respectful to others. This makes everyone feel happy and safe at school.

Understand Teen Development.module_name: Physical Changes in the Teen Years
Understand Teen Development.introduction.msg_list: In this lesson, we continue to learn about the changes your teen may experience as they get older. Today, we are exploring their physical changes. These changes are part of the phase of reaching sexual maturity called puberty.
Understand Teen Development.importance.msg_list: Talking openly with Your Teen about the changes they are experiencing in their body can help them reduce their stress around these changes and care for themselves
Understand Teen Development.quiz.intro: Here‚Äôs a quick quiz to see how much you know about puberty!
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.question: What is puberty, and when does it often begin for girls?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.values: A time when the body goes through physical and hormonal changes. It often begins between ages 8 and 13 for girls|A time when the mind becomes more mature. It often begins between ages 16 and 18 for girls|A time when the body stops growing. It often begins around age 25 for girls
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.answer: A time when the body goes through physical and hormonal changes. It often begins between ages 8 and 13 for girls
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct: Correct! Puberty is when a person's body undergoes changes as they grow into adults. For girls, puberty starts between ages 8 and 13.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect: üëÄ Oops! Good Try! Puberty is when a person's body goes through changes as they grow into an adult. For girls, puberty starts between ages 8 and 13.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.question: What are some common physical changes that occur during puberty for girls?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.values: Increased height, deeper voice, and wider shoulders|Growth of breasts, pubic and underarm hair, and menstruation|Less hunger, longer sleep patterns, and more energy levels
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.answer: Growth of breasts, pubic and underarm hair, and menstruation
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct: Correct! During puberty, girls undergo many physical changes. These include growing breasts, hair in the pubic and underarm areas, and starting their menstrual cycle.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. During puberty, girls go through a lot of physical changes. These include growing breasts, hair in the pubic and underarm areas, and starting their menstrual cycle.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.question: How can parents support their daughters during puberty?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.values: By talking openly about puberty and offering reassurance and support|By ignoring the changes and allowing their daughter to figure it out on her own|By discouraging their daughter from asking questions and seeking help if needed
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.answer: By talking openly about puberty and offering reassurance and support
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct: Correct! Talking about puberty is important for parents to help their daughters feel comfortable and confident. This can make girls feel better about growing up.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. Talking about puberty is important for parents to help their daughters feel comfortable and confident. This can make girls feel better about growing up.
Understand Teen Development.tips.intro: Here is what you need to know about Your Teen‚Äôs developing body and how to talk with them about it:
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ TALK

üå± Help Your Teen understand it is normal to go through physical changes during puberty.

‚úÖ Tell Your Teen that these changes happen to everyone and that they are not alone.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ LEARN

‚≠ê Provide Your Teen with accurate information about puberty, sex, and the changes they are experiencing. This will help them make good decisions to stay healthy and safe.

üíõ Encourage them to ask questions and seek help if they need it.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ SUPPORT

üçö Encourage Your Teen to develop healthy habits like eating a balanced diet, getting enough sleep, and exercising regularly.

‚öΩ Help them find activities they enjoy doing to feel confident and strong in their body.üíôHelp Your Teen think about the consequences of their behaviours without shame or blame. Guide them on where they can find information to inform their decisions.
Understand Teen Development.video.message:

2Ô∏è‚É£ LEARN
3Ô∏è‚É£ SUPPORT

‚ñ∂Ô∏èPress play to learn about the physical changes Your Teen is experiencing: 1Ô∏è‚É£ TALK

Understand Teen Development.module_name: Physical Changes in the Teen Years
Understand Teen Development.introduction.msg_list: In this lesson, we continue to learn about the changes your teen may experience as they get older. Today, we are exploring their physical changes. These changes are part of the phase of reaching sexual maturity called puberty.
Understand Teen Development.importance.msg_list: Talking openly with Your Teen about the changes they are experiencing in their body can help them reduce their stress around these changes and care for themselves.  Understanding the changes happening in the body can also help reduce stress around any big changes they experience.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.intro: Here‚Äôs a quick quiz to see how much you know about puberty!
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.question: What is puberty, and when does it often begin for boys?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.values: A time when the body goes through physical and hormonal changes. It often begins between ages 9 and 14 for boys|A time when the mind becomes more mature. It often begins between ages 16 and 18 for boys|A time when the body stops growing. It often begins around age 25 for boys
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.answer: A time when the body goes through physical and hormonal changes. It often begins between ages 9 to 14 for boys
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct: Correct! Puberty is when a person's body undergoes changes as they grow into adults. For boys, puberty starts between ages 9 and 14.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect: üëÄ Oops! Good Try! Puberty is when a person's body goes through changes as they grow into an adult. For boys, puberty starts between ages 9 and 14.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.question: What are some common physical changes that occur during puberty for boys?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.values: Widening of hips and gaining weight |Enlargement of testicles, growth of pubic and underarm hair, and increased height|Less hunger, longer sleep patterns, and more energy levels
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.answer: Enlargement of testicles, growth of pubic and underarm hair, and increased height
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct: Correct! During puberty, boys undergo many physical changes. These include enlargement of testicles, growth of pubic and underarm hair, and increased height.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. During puberty, boys go through a lot of physical changes. These include enlargement of testicles, growth of pubic and underarm hair, and increased height.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.question: How can parents support their sons during puberty?
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.values: By talking openly about puberty and offering reassurance and support|By ignoring the changes and allowing their son to figure it out on her own|By discouraging their son from asking questions and seeking help if needed
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.answer: By talking openly about puberty and offering reassurance and support
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct: Correct! Talking about puberty is important for parents to help their sons feel comfortable and confident. This can make boys feel better about growing up.
Understand Teen Development.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect: Oops, try again. Talking about puberty is important for parents to help their sons feel comfortable and confident. This can make sons feel better about growing up.
Understand Teen Development.tips.intro: Here is what you need to know about Your Teen‚Äôs developing body and how to talk with them about it:
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ TALK

üå± Help Your Teen understand it is normal to go through physical changes during puberty.

‚úÖ Tell Your Teen that these changes happen to everyone and that they are not alone.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ LEARN

‚≠ê Provide Your Teen with accurate information about puberty, sex, and the changes they are experiencing. This will help them make good decisions to stay healthy and safe.

üíõ Encourage them to ask questions and seek help if they need it.
Understand Teen Development.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ SUPPORT

üçö Encourage Your Teen to develop healthy habits like eating a balanced diet, getting enough sleep, and exercising regularly.

‚öΩ Help them find activities they enjoy doing to feel confident and strong in their body.üíôHelp Your Teen think about the consequences of their behaviours without shame or blame. Guide them on where they can find information to inform their decisions.

Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.introduction.msg_list: This skill is about supporting your teen to find joy and have fun while learning. üòÉ
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.importance.msg_list: Parents play an important role in how your teen learns and develops in and out of school.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.intro: Here is a comic about having fun while learning with your teen.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.1:
Mother: {F1_DAUGHTER_16} what‚Äôs wrong?

{F1_DAUGHTER_16}: I feel overwhelmed and stressed, I don‚Äôt want to do homework anymore.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.2: Mother: I understand, homework can be very stressful. Let‚Äôs take a quick dance break! This always helped me to feel energised and ready to work!
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.4: Mother: Okay now that we have some energy lets try this again. What are you stressed about?
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.intro: Here are three tips to help you facilitate joyful and fun learning with your teen.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *PLAY*

üå± Giving your teen time to have fun and be joyful  improves their  physical and mental health AND their ability to learn and remember important facts!

‚öΩ Play games

‚è∞ If your teen starts to feel overwhelmed with school work, help them reduce their stress by taking a pause or having fun together.

üí°Incorporate your teen‚Äôs interests in their learning.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *BE POSITIVE*

üéàFew teens actually enjoy homework. You can empathise with their frustration, but remind them why homework matters: it strengthens what they have learned at school, and teaches them how to manage their time wisely.

üòÉ Encourage and praise your teen when they are learning.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *ALLOW CREATIVITY*

üé® Allow your teen to be creative when learning. For example, encourage your teen to draw or go outside to help their learning.
 
‚ú®If your teen is interested in a new topic, talk to them about it and  encourage them to explore and find out more about it.

üíô Set a good example: Let your teen see you being creative, trying something new, even if you are not good at it yet.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.video.message: Here‚Äôs a video message on supporting your teen to find joy while learning!
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.audio.message: Here‚Äôs an audio message on supporting your teen to find joy while learning!
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.home_activity.activity: Home activity! ‚≠ê Invite your teen to take a small break from homework and do something active for five minutes. You can dance, play football, do jumping jacks, or go for a jog. Breaking up their school work will help them remember information and the physical activity will keep them alert for studying. Do you have time to do it today? ‚è∞
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! Use the tips you have learnt today and have fun! Experiencing joy during learning with your teen is a great way to motivate them to learn. üíô
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! If you don't have time today, set some time aside tomorrow.

Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.introduction.msg_list: Caregivers play an important role in how your teen learns and creates meaning in life.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.importance.msg_list: This skill is about helping your teen learn by setting goals. üòÉ
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.intro: Here is a comic about setting goals.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.1:
Father: {F1_DAUGHTER_16} you are starting a new year at school, and I am very excited for you. What are your goals for this year?

{F1_DAUGHTER_16}: I want to be the best student in the class!
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.2:
Father: That is a wonderful goal, {F1_DAUGHTER_16}. What do you think you will need to do to make it happen?

{F1_DAUGHTER_16}: Okay‚Ä¶what about I want to get an A on my first maths exam!
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.3:
Father: Very good! And how will you get an A on your first maths exam?

{F1_DAUGHTER_16}: Let‚Äôs see‚Ä¶how about I make time to study maths every day. And maybe you can help me out if I get stuck on something?
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.4: Father: I will try my best! If you work hard and keep your routine of studying every day, I am sure you will be able to accomplish your goal!
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.intro: Here are three tips to help your teen learn:
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *SET GOALS*

üèÅ Support your teen to set goals for something they want to do. 

üìñ Help them make their goals specific and measurable. The goals should be something that they can complete within a specific amount of time.

üéì Help them understand the connection between learning and achieving their goals.

üå±This builds their motivation to learn.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *ASK QUESTIONS*

‚ùì Encourage your teen to ask questions.

üòÉ Ask your teen questions.

üí° Don‚Äôt worry if you do not know the answer. Try finding the answer together by looking online, or asking teachers in your school.
 
üéìCuriosity will help your teen‚Äôs brain grow!
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *MAKE CONNECTIONS*

üìñ Ask your teen to connect new information to things they already know, such as one of their interests or a topic from school.

üîëThis develops and promotes deeper thinking and understanding of concepts.

Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.audio.message: Here‚Äôs an audio message on supporting your teen to find joy while learning!

Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! Use the tips you have learnt today and have fun! Experiencing joy during learning with your teen is a great way to motivate them to learn üíô

Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.module_name: Create a Positive Learning Space for Your Teen
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.introduction.msg_list: This skill is about how to create a positive learning space for your teen.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.importance.msg_list: Your teen will learn much better when they are in a space that supports their learning. üòÉ
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.intro: Here is a comic about creating a learning space for your teen.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.1:
{F1_SON_18}: Mum, I am home!

Mother: Welcome home, sweetie, did you have a good day at school?
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.2: {F1_SON_18}: Yes, now I have to do homework!
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.3: Mother: Perfect, I have cleared some space for you in the kitchen so you can focus and have some quiet while I cook dinner.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.4:
{F1_SON_18}: Thank you mum! Once I am done I can help you with dinner. 

Mother: Thank you, that is great!
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.intro: A great learning space requires these things:
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *QUIET*

‚úÖ Effective learning requires focus. Find time and space for your teen to learn with not many distractions.

‚ùåAsk your teen to keep the phone away from the study space. 

‚ùå Turn off music and reduce other noise so your teen can concentrate.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *ROUTINE*

‚úÖ If possible, encourage your teen to complete school work before beginning their chores. This shows your teen that their education is important to you.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *SUPPORT*

‚ùå Try not to disturb your teen while they are working.

‚úÖLet them know you are here to help if they need support.

‚úÖ Ask what they need to accomplish today, and praise them if they achieve their goal.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.video.message: Here‚Äôs a video message on supporting your teen to create a space for them to learn.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.audio.message: Here‚Äôs an audio message on supporting your teen to create a space for them to learn.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! ‚≠êTalk with your teen to find the right study spot in your home. Do you have time to do it today? ‚è∞
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! Use the tips you have learnt today to set your teen up for academic success. üíô
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! If you don't have time today, set some time aside tomorrow.

Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.introduction.msg_list: Today‚Äôs parenting skill is about helping your teen know how to learn from their mistakes.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.importance.msg_list: Learning from our mistakes can help us avoid them in the future. It can also help us be more supportive to ourselves and less harsh when things do not go well. üòÉ
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.intro: Here is a comic about learning from your mistakes:
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.1:
Mother: What happened honey?

{F1_SON_18}: I got a bad grade on my maths test.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.2:
Mother: I am sorry you got a bad result. You must be very frustrated.

{F1_SON_18}: Yes, especially since I thought I understood everything already.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.3:
Mother: I know you are still amazing and smart. Do you know what went wrong?

{F1_SON_18}: I guess I was too confident, so I did not study.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.4:
Mother: Ah well, at least you now know that it is important to study for every test no matter how confident you feel. Would you like some help to remind you next time?

{F1_SON_18}: It is okay, Mama. I will remember. Thanks for understanding.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.intro: Here are four tips that you can use to help your teen learn from their mistakes:
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *TALK*

üëÇ Create space and time for your teen to talk with you about their life. 

üíô If their day was challenging, listen to them, and give space to let them share.

üíõ Give them support and show you care. Tell them, "that sounds difficult.‚Äù
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *PRAISE EFFORT*

üíõ Praise your teen for the effort they put into their learning even if they did not succeed.

‚ú® Effort is more important than mastering a specific skill.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *ALLOW FOR MISTAKES TO HAPPEN*

üå± Allow your teen to make mistakes. Let them learn from their own mistakes so they can learn and grow.

‚ùì It is tempting to want to solve every problem for your teen, especially when you know better. This will not teach them to solve their own problems.

üòÉ Talk to your teen about their mistakes and allow them figure out a way to solve their problems and do better next time.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ *SHARE*

üìñ Try and share your own failures with your teen and discuss how they helped you develop and grow.

‚úÖThis helps your teen learn that you do not have to be perfect all the time.

Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.audio.message: Here‚Äôs an audio message on supporting your teen to create a space for them to learn.

Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! Use the tips you have learnt today to help your teen gain mental strength.

Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.module_name: Learning How to Work with Other People
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.introduction.msg_list: This skill is about helping your teen learn how to work with others.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.importance.msg_list: In order to succeed at home, school, and work, your teen will need to know how to work with others.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.intro: Here is a comic on helping your teen learn to work with others:
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.1: Father: My daughter, {F1_DAUGHTER_16}, has been struggling with English, do you have any recommendations?
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.2:
Teacher: Yes, how about you set up a book club with your daughter and her friends where they can read and discuss the book together?

Father: That sounds great!
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.3: {F1_DAUGHTER_16}: Did anyone understand chapter 3? I need some help making sense of it.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.comic.text.4:
{F1_DAUGHTER_16}: Thank you so much for suggesting a book club, Dad. Our reading assignments are more fun and easier to understand when I work on them together with my friends. 

Father: I am glad it is working for you. Even as an adult, I still learn a lot from others! Just last week, your mother taught me how to make this delicious chicken stew I am making for dinner.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.intro: You can help them build this skill with these tips:
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *BE SOCIAL*

üòÉ Allow your teen to go and study with friends in a safe way. You can call these friends, ‚Äòstudy buddies.‚Äô
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *TEAM WORK*

üëÇ Encourage your teen to listen to and respect others and their ideas.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.video.message: Here‚Äôs a video message on supporting your teen to be social and learn with others.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.audio.message: Here‚Äôs an audio message on supporting your teen to be social and learn with others.
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! ‚≠ê Chat with your teen and identify a possible study buddy for the next week. Do you have time to do it today? ‚è∞
Support My Teen‚Äôs Education.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! Use the tips you have learnt today and have fun! Experiencing joy during learning with your teen is a great way to motivate them to learn. üíô

Create Structure for My Teen.introduction.msg_list: Today‚Äôs skill is all about how to help your child follow instructions. üòÉ
Create Structure for My Teen.importance.msg_list:
Even the best behaved children only follow instructions about 50% of the time. ‚è∞

Being more effective about how we give instructions can make things more peaceful and calm at home. üå±
Create Structure for My Teen.quiz.content.1.question: True or false: It does not matter whether you give an instruction in a positive or negative way.
Create Structure for My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
‚≠ê That‚Äôs correct! 

Children are more likely to follow an instruction when it is worded in a positive way. 

üíô Negative instructions like, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt do that!‚Äù can make children (and us) feel bad üò£
Create Structure for My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
‚ùå That‚Äôs incorrect. 

Children are more likely to follow an instruction when it is worded in a positive way. 

üíô Negative instructions like, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt do that!‚Äù can make children (and us) feel bad üò£
Create Structure for My Teen.comic.intro: {F3_DAUGTHER_4} is playing with the handphone on the floor.
Create Structure for My Teen.comic.text.1:
{F3_MOTHER}: It is nice to see you playing quietly with the handphone while I clear up after dinner, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. In 3 minutes, it will be bedtime and you will need to give the handphone back to me.

{F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Okay, Mummy.
Create Structure for My Teen.comic.text.2:
{F3_MOTHER}: {after 3 minutes] 3 minutes is over, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Please give me back the phone.

{F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Okay.
Create Structure for My Teen.comic.text.3:
{F3_MOTHER}: Thank you very much for giving me the phone when I asked you, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Because you listened so well, I will read you an extra story tonight.

{F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Yay!
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.intro: 3Ô∏è‚É£ Here are three tips on how to help Your Child follow instructions more often:
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ BE SPECIFIC

‚≠êSay the behaviour you want your child to do. For example: ‚ÄúPlease take your shoes off when you come inside, Adam.‚Äù
üëÄUse your child‚Äôs name to get your child‚Äôs attention. Go down to their level. Get their eye contact.
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ BE REALISTIC

‚≠êMake sure that the instruction is something that your child can do. 
üí°Give one instruction at a time. It can be difficult for your child to remember many instructions! 
‚è∞If possible, give a transition warning: ‚ÄúIn 3 minutes, it will be bedtime and you will need to give the cellphone back to me.‚Äù
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ BE POSITIVE

‚≠êUse positive words when giving instructions. For example, instead of ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt shout,‚Äù say ‚ÄúTalk in a quiet voice.‚Äù
üí°Give instructions in a firm voice and stay calm. Behave as if you expect your child to do what you ask.
üéÅPraise, praise, praise! Make sure you praise your child immediately when they follow your instruction.
üå∑Also, be kind to yourself if you forget sometimes. Learning how to give positive instructions is not easy, but it works! üíô
Create Structure for My Teen.video.message: ‚ñ∂Ô∏è This video teaches you 3Ô∏è‚É£ three tips to help your child follow instructions more often
Create Structure for My Teen.audio.message: ‚ñ∂Ô∏è This audio message teaches you 3Ô∏è‚É£ three tips to help your child follow instructions more often
Create Structure for My Teen.home_activity.activity: Home activity! ‚≠êTry to give specific, realistic, and positive instructions with your child. Do you have time to do this today? ‚è∞
Create Structure for My Teen.home_activity.positive_msg: üéâThat's great! Try to remember to praise your child whenever they follow your instruction. You can do it!
Create Structure for My Teen.home_activity.negative_msg: üíöThat's OK! Learning something new takes time, patience, and practice. You might want to start by thinking of 1 instruction that you find yourself giving your child a lot of the time. Practice with your partner first! üîÑ
Create Structure for My Teen.congratulations.msg_list: Amazing! üéâ You have learnt how to Help Your Child Follow Instructions! You have now completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Give My Child Structure. üèÜ

Create Structure for My Teen.introduction.msg_list: This skill is about creating family rules or guidelines with Your Teen.
Create Structure for My Teen.importance.msg_list: Family rules can help our teens stay safe from danger, both inside our homes and in the community. Your Teen is more likely to follow rules they help to make. ‚≠ê
Create Structure for My Teen.comic.text.1:
Mama: "You always come home late!"

{F1_SON_18}: "No I don‚Äôt, I don‚Äôt even know what late means! Stop nagging me."
Create Structure for My Teen.comic.text.2:
Let‚Äôs see how Mama and {F1_SON_18} did this the next day:

Mama: ‚ÄúI want you to have fun, {F1_SON_18}, but I‚Äôm also worried about you staying out late. Do you know why?‚Äù

{F1_SON_18}: ‚ÄúBecause you want me to have enough time for my schoolwork?‚Äù
Create Structure for My Teen.comic.text.3: Mama: ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs right, and it‚Äôs also not safe in this area to be outside after sunset. What do you think would be a good time for you to be home?‚Äù
Create Structure for My Teen.comic.text.4:
{F1_SON_18}: ‚ÄúI could come home at 10pm?"

Mama: ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a bit late, what about 6pm? Or something in the middle?"
Create Structure for My Teen.comic.text.5:
{F1_SON_18}: ‚ÄúI could come home at 6pm on school nights and 10pm on Friday and Saturday?‚Äù

Mama: ‚ÄúYes, great. From now on, our household rule is that you need to come home at 6pm on school nights and 10pm on Friday and Saturday. But you always walk home with a friend. Okay?‚Äù
Create Structure for My Teen.comic.text.6:
{F1_SON_18}: ‚ÄúOkay, Mama‚Äù
Mama: ‚ÄúThank you very much, Joshua, for helping to come up with a good rule together. I am proud to see how responsible you are getting.‚Äù
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.intro: Here are some easy tips to help you make family rules with your teens:
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *BE A TEAM*

‚è∞ Create rules with your teen.

‚è∏ Make one rule at a time.

üîë Talk about the reasons for the rule.

üëÇ Listen to their view.
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *KEEP IT REAL*

‚≠ê Make rules realistic: What can your teen actually do?

üìñ Be clear and specific about what you want them to do.

‚úÖ Make sure the rule is fair. Explain the reason for the rule.
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *BE CONSISTENT*

üîÑ Once you set a rule, stick to it.
 
‚¨ÜÔ∏è They are more likely to follow the rule.

‚ñ∂Ô∏è If the rule includes you, it is important that you stick to it too.
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ *PRAISE, PRAISE, PRAISE*

‚≠ê Praise your teen for setting a family rule with you. 

üòÉ Praise your teen when they follow the rule, just like you do when they behave well!
Create Structure for My Teen.video.message: Here is a video about setting family rules with Your Teen. üìñ
Create Structure for My Teen.audio.message: Here's an audio message about setting family rules with Your Teen. üëÇ

Create Structure for My Teen.home_activity.positive_msg: That's great to hear! Remember, when you involve your teen when you make rules, they are more likely to follow them. It's a recipe for success! üèÜ
