Create Structure for My Teen.importance.msg_list: If your child feels loved and supported at home, they are more likely to happily do chores and to grow into a healthy child and adult! üòÉüíö
Create Structure for My Teen.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: If I make a mistake or do something that upsets my child, I should pretend it didn‚Äôt happen, smile at them, and do a more positive activity with them.
Create Structure for My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
üèÜ Correct! 

üíõ Admitting mistakes and apologising teaches them to respect others and that it is okay to get things wrong sometimes.

‚ùó Ignoring a mistake when it affects your child teaches them that they do not need to take responsibility for their actions.
Create Structure for My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
‚ùå That‚Äôs not right. 

üíõ Admitting mistakes and apologising teaches them to respect others and that it is okay to get things wrong sometimes.

‚ùó Ignoring a mistake when it affects your child teaches them that they do not need to take responsibility for their actions.
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.intro: 4Ô∏è‚É£ Here are four tips to help you know what your role is as your child‚Äôs caregiver and to teach them their role, too.
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ KNOW YOUR ROLE

As a caregiver, your role is to make sure Your Child:
üî∑ has enough healthy food,
üî∑ has the clothes they need,
üî∑ stays safe from harm,
üî∑ contributes to family needs, like doing chores, 
üî∑ learns the morals and values you wish them to, such as honesty,
üî∑ has opportunities to express themselves,
üî∑ has opportunities to play, and
üî∑ feels loved and supported, no matter what.
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ TEACH

Tell Your Child what their role in the family is. This can include:
üî∂ doing age-appropriate chores, like putting their toys away, making their beds, and sort laundry
üî∂ listening when their caregivers ask something of them
üî∂ being respectful to others in the family
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ DO AS I DO

üëÄ Your child will learn from your actions much more than from the words you tell them. They notice more than you might think!
üå∑ Treat your child and those around you in the way you would want your child to act: with respect, kindness, patience, and love.
‚ùå Shouting at or hitting your child will only teach them to hit others when they are upset.
üíö Talk to them calmly and set a clear consequence so they learn to be calm with themselves and with others. You‚Äôll learn more about consequences in the next goal.
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ NOTICE

üé® Notice what your child enjoys doing, and help them do more of it. 
‚ú® If Your Child feels as if their needs and interests are respected, they are more likely to willingly do their chores in the home!
üéÅ Notice and praise them when they do the tasks that are their responsibility so they learn what is expected of them. This way, they are more likely to do it again.
Create Structure for My Teen.video.message: ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Press play to watch a video message about everyone‚Äôs role in the home. üí°
Create Structure for My Teen.audio.message: ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Press play to hear a message about everyone‚Äôs role in the home. üí°

This shows them they are a valued member of your home. üíõ Do you have time to do it today?
Create Structure for My Teen.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! üíô This will help Your Child feel loved and supported, which can lead to better behaviour.
Create Structure for My Teen.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! If you don't have time today, set some time aside tomorrow. Talking to Your Child about something they like helps them feel loved and supported, which can lead to better behaviour!

Create Structure for My Teen.introduction.msg_list: This skill is about how to keep Your Teen safe online. There is so much to share. We will cover online safety over two lessons. üì±
Create Structure for My Teen.importance.msg_list: Teens are spending a lot of time online. Being connected helps them stay positive and learn more! But there are also some risks and dangers. üö©
Create Structure for My Teen.comic.text.1:
Mama: "{F1_DAUGHTER_13}, have you done your homework?"

{F1_DAUGHTER_13}: "Just a minute, I'm finishing this TikTok video"
Create Structure for My Teen.comic.text.2:
Mama: "You are a really great dancer! Tell me about why you like it."

{F1_DAUGHTER_13}: "All my friends are on it. I have more than 600 likes and 120 followers."
Create Structure for My Teen.comic.text.3: Mama: "I‚Äôm proud of how well you dance, {F1_DAUGHTER_13}. But we need to make sure you are safe on this. I know your friends look at TikTok, but with an open account there are also paedophiles who look at videos of teenagers. Paedophiles are older people who want to attack young children and teens."
Create Structure for My Teen.comic.text.4: Mama: "Let‚Äôs look together online at how we can keep this fun for you but also safe. Look ‚Äì you can make your account private and control who follows you. So you can accept people you know but not strangers. Can we make a rule together that you can use TikTok but with a private account? I trust you to know who to accept!"
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.intro:
Keeping Your Teen safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. üì±When it comes to online safety, there are four tips to keep in mind: 
LEARN, PROTECT, BUILD HABITS, and BUILD TRUST.

Today, we are learning about LEARN and PROTECT. 
The next lesson will cover BUILD HABITS and BUILD TRUST.
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *LEARN the dangers of being online:* 

üö© CONTENT: Your teen might come across harmful content, such as violence, hateful speech, pornography, wrong information, or hating women, people with disabilities, or other races, religions, sexualities, or from other countries.

üö© CONTACT: Adults might pretend to be teens and ask for sexual pictures or to meet with your teen through an online platform.

üö© CONDUCT: Sometimes, teens or strangers can say or do hurtful things online.
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *PROTECT - Keep your teen safe online*

‚úÖ Talk to your teen about which apps and websites are safe and which are not. Discuss why!

‚úÖ Help your teen learn how to make strong passwords to protect their devices.
Create Structure for My Teen.video.message:
Keeping your teen safe online is important to help them learn more about the digital world. üì± 

Here‚Äôs a video about keeping your teen safe online.
Create Structure for My Teen.audio.message:
Keeping your teen safe online is important to help them learn more about the digital world. üì± 

Here's an audio message about keeping your teen safe online. üëÇ
Create Structure for My Teen.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! Ask your teen what they do to stay safe online? You may find that they are already thinking about online safety. Praise your teen for any efforts they make. Can you talk with Your Teen today? üîî
Create Structure for My Teen.home_activity.positive_msg: That‚Äôs great! Helping your teen stay safe online is important so they can learn and connect with others. Well done for getting involved. They will be safer for it! üîë
Create Structure for My Teen.home_activity.negative_msg: That‚Äôs OK. Put some time aside this week to do this activity with your teen. ‚è∞ It‚Äôs important to talk to our teens about how to stay safe online so they can use the digital world to learn more and connect with others. You can do this! ‚≠ê
Create Structure for My Teen.congratulations.msg_list: Amazing! üéâ You have learnt how to keep your teen safe online. You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills in the Create Structure for My Teen Goal!

Create Structure for My Teen.introduction.msg_list: This skill continues our learning about keeping our teens safe online. üì±
Create Structure for My Teen.importance.msg_list:
The previous skill taught you ways to protect your teen online using with LEARN and PROTECT. 

In this skill, we will learn how to BUILD HABITS and BUILD TRUST.
Create Structure for My Teen.quiz.intro: Often, our teens understand more about life online than we do, but that does not mean they know how to keep safe. Let‚Äôs test your online safety knowledge.
Create Structure for My Teen.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: If I send a picture to a friend, it will only be visible to them.
Create Structure for My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct: That‚Äôs correct. Even in an app where images are temporary, your friend can capture their screen and save your image. Pictures are always stored online and can be accessed by hackers.
Create Structure for My Teen.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect: That‚Äôs incorrect. Even in an app where images are temporary, your friend can capture their screen and save your image. Pictures are always stored online and can be accessed by hackers.
Create Structure for My Teen.quiz.content.2.question: True or False: My password is strong because you have to know my home address to guess it.
Create Structure for My Teen.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct: That‚Äôs correct. Most passwords are hacked because someone accesses a list of home addresses, birth dates, names or phone numbers. You should never use these details in your password as they are easily guessed.
Create Structure for My Teen.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect: That‚Äôs incorrect. Most passwords are hacked because someone accesses a list of home addresses, birth dates, names or phone numbers. You should never use these details in your password as they are easily guessed.
Create Structure for My Teen.quiz.content.3.question: True or False: Links sent to me by my family and friends are safe to click on.
Create Structure for My Teen.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct: That‚Äôs right. Your family member‚Äôs email or phone account could be hacked. Always double-check a link before clicking on it to make sure you‚Äôre visiting a trusted website. If you don‚Äôt recognize the web address, don‚Äôt click on it.
Create Structure for My Teen.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect: That‚Äôs incorrect. Your family member‚Äôs email or phone account could have been hacked and the link could be dangerous. Hackers will try to trick you. Always double-check a link before clicking on it to make sure you‚Äôre visiting a trusted website. If you don‚Äôt recognize the web address, don‚Äôt click on it.
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.intro: Keeping Your Teen safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. üì± Today, we are learning how to BUILD HABITS and BUILD TRUST.
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *BUILD HABITS*

Set up safe online habits at home. 

‚úÖ Plan phone-free times in your house, like during meals, homework, or in bed.

‚úÖ Only let your teen chat online with people they already know. They should never share personal information in a chat room or with strangers.

‚úÖ Before completing forms that ask for personal information, check that the web address begins with https://. Websites that begin with http:// may not be secure.

‚úÖ Help your teen create strong passwords for their accounts. They should be long, not include obvious personal information like your name or birthday, and include upper and lower case letters, numbers and symbols."

‚úÖ Tell your teen not to click on pop-ups that ask them to download or pay for anything.
Create Structure for My Teen.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *BUILD TRUST with your teen.*

‚úÖ Together, look at websites, social media, games, and apps your teen uses. 

‚úÖ Ask questions - this helps you learn more about your teen‚Äôs interests!

‚úÖIf you come across anything worrying together, talk about it with your teen.

‚úÖTell your teen that they should tell an adult if they feel scared, unsafe or upset about something online.
Create Structure for My Teen.video.message:
Keeping your teen safe online is important to help them learn more about the digital world. üì±

Here‚Äôs a 2nd video about keeping your teen safe online.
Create Structure for My Teen.audio.message:
Keeping your teen safe online is important to help them learn more about the digital world. üì±

Here's a second audio message about keeping your teen safe online. üëÇ

 üìù Write down or draw the apps and websites your teen uses

üì± Together, talk about how your teen and their friends can use the internet more safely.

Create Structure for My Teen.home_activity.negative_msg: That‚Äôs OK. Put some time aside this week to do this activity with your teen. ‚è∞ It‚Äôs important to talk to our teens about how to stay safe online so they can use the digital world to learn more and connect with others. You can do this! ‚≠ê
Create Structure for My Teen.congratulations.msg_list: Amazing! üéâ You have learnt how to keep your teen safe online. You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills in the Create Structure for My Teen Goal!

Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.introduction.msg_list: In this goal, we are learning about the four steps to building a family budget with our teens. The first step is identifying needs and wants. üí∞
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.importance.msg_list: Managing how money is spent is important to ensure that parents are able to provide for our teens. When money is tight, this can make us feel anxious, stressed, and sad. Talking with your teen about the difference between something that you need and something that you want can help them understand how to prioritise spending limited money.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.intro: Let's learn about the first step to family budgeting with your teen!
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *IDENTIFY NEEDS*

Make a list of things that you or your teen think you cannot live without. Things that are important for your family to survive. üíö

For example food üçö, soap to wash hands, or medicine üè•.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *IDENTIFY WANTS*

Make a list of things that you or your teen want. These are things that would be nice to have but not essential üéÅ. 

For example the latest version of a smartphone, new toy, or magazine.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *TALK*

People often see things in different ways. You may find that your teen sees one thing as a NEED while you see it as a WANT. Talk with your teen about why you feel differently, this will help you to understand each other and can make decisions together about what to spend money on. üí∞
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.video.message: Press play to watch a video about needs and wants.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.audio.message: Press play to hear a message about needs and wants.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! ‚≠ê Try to discuss your wants and needs with your teen. Do you have time to do it today?
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.home_activity.positive_msg: That‚Äôs great! Try to make this a two-way conversation with your teen. Discussing Needs and Wants is very important for creating a successful budget plan. üíö
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.home_activity.negative_msg: That‚Äôs OK. The best place to start is by thinking about your own wants and needs before speaking with your teen. Once you feel comfortable, you can take the next step and complete step two of setting a family budget with your teen. Remember you can refer back to this content in the Main Menu.üíö
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.congratulations.msg_list: Well done, you have completed the first step to family budgeting with your teen.

Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.introduction.msg_list: In this goal, we are learning about the four steps to building a family budget with our teens. Today, we are learning about step 2: talking about monthly expenses.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.importance.msg_list: Knowing what your family‚Äôs monthly expenses are can be helpful for you and your teen. It can help them understand why money is being spent on some things and not on others.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.intro: Here is how you can list your monthly expenses with your teen:
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.1.text: üìù Get a piece of paper (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and a pen.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.2.text: üé® Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.3.text: üñäÔ∏èWrite next to each picture how much each thing costs.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.4.text: ‚ûïAdd up how much money you have to spend each month.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.5.text: üì∑Take a picture of the paper or save it for Step 3!
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.video.message: Here‚Äôs a video about starting to build a family budget.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.audio.message: Here‚Äôs an audio message about starting to build a family budget.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.home_activity.activity: Home activity! ‚≠ê Find time to talk about your expenses with your teen. Do you have time to do it today?
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.home_activity.positive_msg: That‚Äôs great! Involving your teen will help them learn how to make a budget and understand how money is spent in the family! üíö
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.home_activity.negative_msg: That‚Äôs OK. You may want to start by doing this activity by yourself or with your partner. You can then do it again with your teen. Remember you can refer back to this content in the Main Menu. üíö
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.congratulations.msg_list: Well done, you have completed the second step to family budgeting with your teen.

Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.introduction.msg_list: In this goal, we are learning about the four steps to building a family budget with our teens. Today, we are reviewing step 3: making a monthly budget. üí∞
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.importance.msg_list: Balancing the money you earn with the money you need to spend is an important step in making a monthly budget. When you involve your teen, they also learn how to do this for themselves!
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.intro: Here is how you can build a monthly budget with your teen:
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.1.text: üé® Take the piece of paper from the monthly expenses activity that shows all the things you spend money on during a month.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.2.text: üëõ Add up all the money your family has available each month. This can be from a job, welfare grants, or even money sent to the family by other relatives.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.3.text: üíµDecide with your teen which of the expenses are things that you NEED and which are things that you WANT.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.4.text: ‚≠ê Draw a star next to everything that you NEED. Add up all the things that have a star next to it.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.5.text: Is the amount more or less than your monthly budget? If it is less, you can add some things that you WANT. If it is more, then you may want to discuss with your teen which things are really NEEDS. You may need to make difficult choices between different things.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.video.message: Here‚Äôs a video about building a monthly budget.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.audio.message: Here‚Äôs an audio message about building a monthly budget.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! ‚≠ê It's time to make a monthly budget with your teen. Do you have time to do it today?
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.home_activity.positive_msg: That‚Äôs great! Involving your teen in making a budget is a great skill for both of you to learn. üíö
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.home_activity.negative_msg: That‚Äôs OK. You might want to start by doing this with your partner or by yourself before involving your teen. Once you feel comfortable, you can take the next step of family budgeting. Remember you can refer back to this content in the Main Menu. üíö
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.congratulations.msg_list: Well done, you have completed the third step to family budgeting with your teen.üåà

Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.introduction.msg_list: Congratulations! You have reached the final step to family budgeting with your teen: make a saving plan. You should be very proud of your dedication. üí∞
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.importance.msg_list: Making a saving plan can help you prepare for crises while also having funds for your teen‚Äôs education and other things that you may need in the future. Even a small amount each month can make a big difference over time.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.comic.text.1: I want the best future for my grandchildren, but I don‚Äôt know where to get the money. Loan sharks are dangerous and paying them back is so expensive. I should save, but that feels impossible!
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.comic.text.2: My goal is to make sure my grandson can go to high school and my granddaughter can reach her dream of university. How can I save a lot of money with the little money I have?
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.comic.text.3: "I know - let‚Äôs start with a plan! First, let me make a budget ‚Äì a plan for how I can save my money. Then I will save just a little bit of money at a time ‚Äì I will even join a savings and loans group."
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.comic.text.4: "I should also speak with my grandchildren to choose things that we can spend just a little bit less on each week. They will help me think of things we want but don‚Äôt need."
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.comic.text.5: A few years later: "Look, we reached our dreams! I didn‚Äôt borrow any money from friends or loan sharks. By saving a tiny bit each week, I managed to pay for John‚Äôs high school and save some money for Neema‚Äôs university. I am so proud of this.‚Äù
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.intro: Here are some tips on how to make a savings plan with your teen:
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.1.text:
*WHY SAVE*

Discuss with your teen different reasons that you might want to save money. These could include:

1Ô∏è‚É£Preparing for emergencies

2Ô∏è‚É£Buying something nice for you or your teen or do something fun as a family

3Ô∏è‚É£Planning for future big expenses like improvements on your home or for your teen‚Äôs education
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.2.text:
*HOW TO SAVE*

Set a target amount that you want to save. Look at your monthly budget and discuss with your teen how much you can save each week and each month.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.3.text:
*WHERE TO SAVE*

Discuss with your teen different ways to keep money safe for future use. These could include:

1Ô∏è‚É£Saving at a bank

2Ô∏è‚É£Keeping money safe at home

3Ô∏è‚É£Keeping money in a savings and loan group

4Ô∏è‚É£Buying livestock like goats or cattle 

Discuss with your teen about the potential good things (benefits) and problems (risks) of each way of saving money. 
Decide which way of saving money would work best for the family.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.4.text: ‚ùó If you can try and save even a tiny amount for the future or for an emergency. This can make a big difference over time.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.tips.message.5.text:
*GET SUPPORT*

Your government or community groups may be giving money, vouchers, or food parcels to families in need. 

Think about whether there are places in your community that provide support.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.video.message: Press play to watch a video about creating a savings plan.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.audio.message: Press play to hear a message about creating a savings plan.
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! ‚≠ê Create a saving plan with your teen. Do you have time to do it today?
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.home_activity.positive_msg: That‚Äôs great! Involving your teen in creating a saving plan will help them learn how to save for their own future, too. üíö
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.home_activity.negative_msg: That‚Äôs OK. You may want to do this first by yourself or with your partner. Involving your teen in creating a saving plan will help them learn how to save for their own future, too. Remember you can refer back to this content in the Main Menu. üíö
Family Budgeting and Ways to Save Money.congratulations.msg_list: Well done, you have completed the final step in making a family budget with your teen. Congratulations! üåà

Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.introduction.msg_list: This skill is about learning to be kind to yourself. ‚òÄÔ∏è Imagine you had a friend who was feeling bad about making a big mistake. üò£ What would you say to them if they told you about it? What tone of voice would you use?
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.importance.msg_list:
Now think about how you talk to yourself when you make a mistake. Is it different? 
Often, we don‚Äôt treat ourselves as well as we treat our friends and family.
;
Being kind to ourselves helps us deal with hard things that happen. When we are kind to ourselves, we can be kind to others.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.comic.intro: {F2_GRANDMOTHER} is the grandmother and only caregiver of two teenagers. She often feels that between work, caregiving, and managing the home, she does not have enough time for her grandchildren. She wants to spend more time with {F2_DAUGHTER_19}, her eldest grandchild. She knows she is struggling with homework, but has not found the time to help.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.comic.text.1:
{F2_GRANDMOTHER}: What is it, {F2_DAUGHTER_19}? Are you okay?

{F2_DAUGHTER_19}: I failed this stupid science exam. I‚Äôm so dumb. I‚Äôll never get this and I will never finish school.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.comic.text.2:
- I‚Äôm trying my best.
- Trying to make ends meet and raise two teenagers alone is very difficult.
- Other parents find this hard too. I‚Äôm not alone.
- This is not the last test that my child will take. There will be other opportunities to help her.
- Things have been very difficult lately, and I need to take some time out to look after myself.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.comic.text.3:
{F2_GRANDMOTHER}: My {F2_DAUGHTER_19}, you are smarter and braver than you know. I am sorry I haven‚Äôt had time to help you more with school work. Let‚Äôs make a plan to prepare for your next exam and you will see just how talented you are.

Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.intro: Here are three steps to help you be kind to yourself. In a few days, we will learn to use the same steps with our teens, but first, let‚Äôs practise with ourselves: NOTICE, SAY IT‚ÄôS OKAY, BE KIND.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *NOTICE*

üò£ Sometimes, it seems easier to ignore negative feelings so they will go away.

‚ùó But ignoring them only means they will come up later - or get worse!

üö© When you feel any negative emotion, notice that you are feeling it.

‚≠ê It can be helpful to name this feeling for yourself.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *SAY IT‚ÄôS OK*

üõëTake a pause or a few deep breaths.

üíõ Now, say to yourself, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs OK,‚Äù because it is OK to have negative feelings - everyone does sometimes!

üòî Often, these feelings come up for a good reason and can tell us something. It really is OK!
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *BE KIND*

üíö When you notice these feelings, it‚Äôs important to be kind and patient with yourself.

üéÅ Think about what kind of advice a loving friend or family member might give you now.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.video.message: Here‚Äôs a video to give you 3 steps for being kind to yourself. It‚Äôs such an important skill!
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.audio.message: Here‚Äôs an audio message to give you three steps for being kind to yourself. It‚Äôs such an important skill!
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.home_activity.intro:
Before we finish, let's practise self-care.

Sit down, close your eyes and listen to your breath as it goes in and out. Notice how you feel. When you are ready, open your eyes again.
;
Listen to your breath.
;
Do you sometimes feel your feelings are too much?
Talk to someone.
Talk to someone you trust. Talk to a friend. Talk to family. 
Get your worries off your chest and then let them go. Even if it‚Äôs just for a moment.
How do you feel now?
A joy shared is twice the joy. A problem shared is half the problem.

Parents sometimes need help and support just like teens do!
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.home_activity.activity: Now that you know how to practice self-care exercises, take a moment to practice again today. The more you practice self care and taking a pause, the easier it will become! Can you do it?
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.home_activity.positive_msg: That‚Äôs great! It‚Äôs important to practice self care so we are able to deal with hard things that happen.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.home_activity.negative_msg:
That‚Äôs OK, it can be hard to set aside time for yourself and treat yourself with kindness. üò£ 
If you feel like you are being hard on yourself, come back to this skill from the Main Menu, and see if you can ask someone for the help you need.

Well done for completing this skill! You have now completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing. 

Remember: Notice, Say it‚Äôs OK, and Be kind to yourself. You‚Äôre doing so well! ‚≠ê

Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.introduction.msg_list:
This skill is about helping our teens with stress. 
Many things can be stressful to your teen: a break-up, stress in your home, being bullied, and exams. These are big life challenges for a teen.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.importance.msg_list:
Teens‚Äô brains are still growing. They don‚Äôt always have good skills for dealing with stress. 

Some teens feel a lot of stress. In response, they might feel anxious, withdraw from others, or even feel sick. Some teens may respond with violence, self-harm, or by using drugs or alcohol to cope.

You can help your teen cope with their stress by supporting them through it.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.quiz.content.1.question: Which of the following is NOT a symptom of stress?
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct: That‚Äôs right. Teens who are stressed experience many symptoms, but playfulness is not one of them.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect: That‚Äôs incorrect. Teens who are stressed experience many symptoms, but playfulness is not one of them.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.intro: Here are some tips you can use to help your teen when they are feeling stressed:
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *NOTICE*

üëÄ Look for signs that your teen is feeling stressed. Their behaviour will often show when they are stressed. 

üö© They might get angry a lot, want to be alone all the time, be unable to focus, feel tired often, or not feel like doing any work.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *TALK*

‚ùì Let your teen share about what makes them stressed. Try to accept what they say. 

üò£ They might feel a lot of stress about something that feels small to us. To them, it might feel huge!

üíõ Let them tell you about what gives them stress without judging them.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *BE THERE*

üëÇ Listen to what they say, even if you can‚Äôt do anything about it.

üíö Tell them it is okay to feel stressed

üí° Help them decide which things are more important to worry about.

üîë Help them take steps to change what is causing their stress where they can.

üìñ Help them prepare for what they are stressing about.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.video.message: ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Press Play to watch a video about helping our teens when they are stressed.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.audio.message: Here‚Äôs an audio message to give you some tips on how to support your teen when they are feeling stressed. üíõ
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.home_activity.activity:
Home Activity! Talk with your teen and make a list of things that bring them stress. Discuss what they could do to avoid or cope with these situations.

Ask your teen how you can help them when they are stressed, too. 

Can you do this with your teen today?
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! This is such a good way to help our teens cope with their stress. üíö Supporting your teen when they are stressed helps them deal with it better, and will help them feel more safe and secure. Well done, keep at it! üèÜ
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.home_activity.negative_msg: That‚Äôs OK. It can be hard to talk about these things! NEXT time your teen is acting outside of what you expect from them, think about if it might be because of stress. üö© You can use the Main Menu to come back to this skill for tips to support them. üíö
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.congratulations.msg_list: Congratulations on completing the skill, Help My Teen with Stress. You‚Äôve completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards the goal, Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.

Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.introduction.msg_list: This skill is about supporting your teen when they are having a difficult time by showing them kindness and support them.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.importance.msg_list: Being a teen can be very stressful, and they might feel like there is a lot going on or too much is being asked of them. üò£ This can lead to negative behaviours that impact their wellbeing and confidence. You can help them by telling them you get it and showing them love through it. üíô
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.comic.text.1: Father: {F1_DAUGHTER_13}, how come you are so quiet today, is something wrong?
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.comic.text.2:
Father: Talking to someone can help you feel better!

{F1_DAUGHTER_13}: Today at school, I got into a fight with my best friend.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.comic.text.3:
Father: I understand why you are sad. If my best friend was mad at me, I would be upset too. Do you want to talk about it?

{F1_DAUGHTER_13}: Thanks, Dad. I wish I could have done things differently.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.comic.text.4:
Father: It is really difficult when we cannot go backwards in time to change what happened. But, you can try to make things better next time. How about we think together about what you could do to fix your relationship?

{F1_DAUGHTER_13}: Okay‚Ä¶
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.comic.text.5:
Father: Thank you for sharing how you are feeling even though it was difficult. As you work through this with your friend, please remember some of the things we talked about together. 

{F1_DAUGHTER_13}: Thank you, Dad.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.intro: Remember the tips we looked at about being kind to yourself? Here are some tips on how you can support your teen when they are having a difficult time:
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *NOTICE*

üëÄ Look out for when your teen is frustrated or upset with themselves about something. Look out for common behaviour, like angry outbursts, shouting, or spending lots of time alone.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *LISTEN*

üëÇGive space for your teen to share what they are experiencing.

üíõTry to accept what your teen is saying.

üîÑ You may want to show that you are listening by repeating back what you hear
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *SAY IT‚ÄôS OK*

üéà Let your teen know that their feelings are normal and that everyone feels like this sometimes. 

üíõ Tell them it is okay to feel like this. 
;
Of course, not every feeling or situation is okay. Remember, if you need help in a crisis, you can type HELP in ParentText to receive a list of community resources where you may find support.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ *COMFORT*

‚≠ê Comfort your teen, and remind them to be kind to themselves.

‚è∞ Be patient and give them time to work through their emotions.

üí° If you think it could help, speak to them about what they could do differently next time.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.video.message: Here‚Äôs a video about showing your teen kindness.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.audio.message: Here's an audio message on treating your teen with compassion. üëÇ
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.home_activity.activity:
Home Activity! Take some time and go through these tips again so you can easily use them when you need them.
Can you do it today?
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.home_activity.positive_msg: That‚Äôs great! Remember to treat your teen how you would like to be treated when you are having a bad day.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.home_activity.negative_msg: That‚Äôs okay. Remember to treat your teen how you would like to be treated when you are having a bad day.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.congratulations.msg_list: Great job! üéâ You have learnt how to support your teen when they are having a difficult time! You have now completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Care for My Teen's Wellbeing. ‚≠ê

Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.introduction.msg_list: This skill is about knowing the warning signs that show your teen may need mental health support. üî¥
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.importance.msg_list: Your Teen may require support for their mental wellbeing and happiness. It is important to know when your teen needs help and what type of support is available.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.quiz.content.1.question: Which of the following is NOT a warning sign?
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.quiz.content.1.values: Changes to sleep|Loss of interest in hobbies|Feeling sad or worthless|Reacting emotionally to news or changes in schedule|A lot of worry
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.quiz.content.1.answer: Reacting emotionally to news or changes in schedule
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct: That‚Äôs correct. It‚Äôs normal for teens to react emotionally to many things.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect: That‚Äôs incorrect. Changes to sleep, loss of interest in hobbies, feeling sad or worthless, and a lot of worry are warning signs. It is normal for teens to react emotionally to news or changes in schedule.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.intro:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *SAY IT‚ÄôS OK*

üéà Let your teen know that their feelings are normal and that everyone feels like this sometimes. 

üíõ Tell them it is okay to feel like this. 
;
Of course, not every feeling or situation is okay. Remember, if you need help in a crisis, you can type {HELP} in ParentText to receive a list of community resources where you may find support.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *NOTICE*

üëÄ Notice the warning signs and behaviour that could show that there may be a problem with your teen‚Äôs mental health:

A lot sleeping or no sleeping
Loss of interest in hobbies
Sudden loss in school and decrease in grades at school
Sudden changes in personality, for example a lot of anger
Feeling sad, empty, or worthless
A lot of worry
Irritability or restlessness
Not wanting to be around people or take part in activities
Extreme panic
Drug and alcohol use
Signs of self-harm, such as cut marks
Expressing ideas about killing oneself
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *ACT EARLY*

‚ùó If you notice some of these signs, it's time to take action. 

‚ùå These warning signs can develop into serious problems. 

üå± Early intervention can have a positive impact on your teens well-being.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *GET HELP*

üòÉ Respect your teen‚Äôs privacy. Talk to your teen about what kind of support they might need. 

üíö Support for you is also really important. Ask for help if you need it. Having a support system can make all the difference.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.video.message: Here is a video on knowing the warning signs.
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.audio.message: Here is a audio message on knowing the warning signs üëÇ
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.home_activity.activity:
Home Activity! Take some time to have a conversation with Your Teen about different sources of support in your community. Share how these resources can be helpful. You can involve other members of the family, too.

Can you make a list with your teen today? üòÉ
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! This will help you and your teen be more prepared whenever you or they need extra support. üíöWell done for thinking ahead! üèÜ
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.home_activity.negative_msg: These conversations are difficult, but it is important your teen knows where to turn for help. You can use the Main Menu to come back to this skill for tips to support them. üíö
Care for My Teen‚Äôs Wellbeing.congratulations.msg_list: Great job! üéâ You have learnt about warning signs! You have now completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Care for My Teen's Wellbeing. ‚≠ê

Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.importance.msg_list: Redirecting behaviour is a way to reduce your teen‚Äôs negative behaviour by redirecting them to more positive ones. ‚û°Ô∏è
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.comic.text.1: Grandma: (Takes a deep breath in) ‚ÄúLet's clean up this mess together‚Äù
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.comic.text.2: Grandma: Next time, please make sure the house is cleaned up before you watch TV.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.comic.text.3: Grandma: Thank you for doing your part and keeping the house clean! I‚Äôm so proud to be your grandma.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.tips.intro: There are four steps to redirecting behaviour: BE CALM, QUICK, CLEAR, and POSITIVE.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *BE CALM*

‚úÖ Take a few breaths before asking your teen to do something else.

‚úÖ Speak with a calm voice.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *BE QUICK*

‚è∞ Ask your teen to do something else, distract them, before the behaviour begins or gets worse.

üí° This is much easier than using consequences after they do something!
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *BE CLEAR*

‚úÖ Rather than saying what you DON‚ÄôT like or want, tell your teen what you DO want them to do.
For example, say:

‚ú® ‚ÄúPlease speak more softly.‚Äù

‚ú® ‚ÄúRemember to walk inside the house.‚Äù

This way, it is easier for them to follow! ‚≠ê
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ *BE POSITIVE*

‚úÖ Praise your teen when they behave well!

‚úÖ Redirecting your teen to a positive behaviour will help you avoid conflict.

‚úÖ It will also help them know what you expect from them!
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.video.message: Here's a video that helps you redirect your teen's behaviour when they misbehave. ‚òÄÔ∏è
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.audio.message: Here's an audio message that helps you redirect your teen's behaviour when they misbehave. ‚û°Ô∏è
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.home_activity.activity:
Home Activity! Share these four steps with another member of your family. Sharing these skills will be great for everyone‚Äôs well being. ‚û°Ô∏è

Can you share these tips today?
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.home_activity.positive_msg: Amazing! ‚ú® Over the next few days, try redirecting your teen from a negative behaviour to a positive one before it gets worse.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! Sometimes it takes time to begin using a new parenting skill. üìù Start by making a list of small negative behaviours you would like to address and think of positive alternatives. Feeling prepared will give you the confidence to start something new! ‚≠ê
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.congratulations.msg_list:
Well done! üéâ You have learnt how to redirect your teen's behaviour! 
You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour. üèÜ

Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.introduction.msg_list: This skill is about learning how to solve problems with Your Teen. üëÇ
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.importance.msg_list: As teens get older, they do more by themselves, and sometimes act outside of the rules we made to keep them safe. üöó This can cause conflict at home. Learning to solve these problems together can make your teen's behaviour better.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.comic.text.2:
SOLVE IT

Think of possible solutions and what would happen if we used them.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.comic.text.3:
TRY IT

Choose a solution and try it out.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.comic.text.4:
TEST IT

Did it work? Great! If it did not work, then try another solution.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.tips.intro: When something happens, take a deep breath. Then, help your teen work on the problem with these 4 steps:
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *KNOW IT*

‚úÖ Put the problem into words.

‚úÖ Talk to your teen about what the problem is.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *SOLVE IT*

‚úÖ Together, think of possible solutions to this problem.

‚úÖ What could you or your teen do differently in this situation in the future?
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *TRY IT*

‚úÖ Choose one solution together.

‚úÖ Try it next time you are in a similar situation.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.tips.message.4.text:
4Ô∏è‚É£ *TEST IT*

‚úÖ Ask yourself, ‚ÄúDid it work?‚Äù 

‚úÖ If yes, great!

‚úÖ If not, talk to your teen about trying another solution next time
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.video.message: Here's a video to help you teach your teen problem-solving skills.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.audio.message: Here's an audio message to help you teach your teen problem-solving skills.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.home_activity.activity:
Home Activity! Talk with your teen about the four steps to problem solving by reviewing this module together. Knowing how to solve problems is something they can use for the rest of their lives!

Can you do it today?
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.home_activity.negative_msg: That's okay. Try to review these steps together sometime this week.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.congratulations.msg_list: Well done! üéâ You have learnt how to solve problems with your teen! You have now completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Manage my Teen‚Äôs Behavior.

Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.introduction.msg_list: This skill helps with what to do when your teen has already done something wrong‚Ä¶ üòî
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.importance.msg_list: Teenagers are still learning who they are and how they want to be in the world. Consequences teach our teens that their actions affect themselves and others. ‚ùó It is important for our teens to learn as they get older. Giving clear consequences teaches teens more than hitting or shouting does.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.comic.intro: Here is a comic that shows how you can involve your teen in establishing fair consequences together.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.comic.text.1:
Father: "I am concerned that you are often still coming home late, {F1_SON_18}. What can we do to help you remember to come home on time?"

{F1_SON_18}: "If I come home on time, maybe I can stay up 30 minutes later than usual?"
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.comic.text.2:
Father: That is a good idea! And what should we do if you don‚Äôt follow the rule?

{F1_SON_18} (mumbles): ‚ÄúMgmluuhm
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.comic.text.3:
Father: "Oh come on, I know you have some ideas."

{F1_SON_18}: "Okay‚Ä¶. What about: I have to do my homework?"
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.comic.text.4:
Father: "You have to do your homework anyway. If you forget the rule, it is fair that you will not be able to see your friends the next day."

{F1_SON_18}: "Okay, Baba."
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.tips.intro: Here are 3 simple steps for using consequences when your teen behaves badly:
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.tips.message.1.text:
1Ô∏è‚É£ *BE CALM*

‚úÖ Shouting at our teens only makes things worse.

‚úÖ Take some deep breaths or walk away if you need to.

‚úÖ Then, respond in a calm, clear way.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.tips.message.2.text:
2Ô∏è‚É£ *BE FAIR*

‚úÖ Give your teen the option to behave before giving a consequence. For example, say, ‚ÄúEither you do your homework now, or you cannot watch your favourite T.V. show tonight.‚Äù

‚úÖ Talk about consequences for breaking household rules when you set them so Your Teen knows them already.

‚úÖ Notice if your teen is experiencing a consequence to their action already.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.tips.message.3.text:
3Ô∏è‚É£ *BE POSITIVE*

‚úÖ Praise your teen for actions you want to see more of so that they know what they are doing right, too!

‚úÖ See if you can avoid giving consequences at all, by redirecting them to something else before they behave badly.

‚úÖ Consequences help our teens learn how their actions affect others - and to think before they act.

‚úÖUsing consequences can be hard at first, but will be easier with practice!
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.video.message: Here's a video that explains how you can use consequences to help your teen act responsibly and respectfully.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.audio.message: Here's an audio message that explains how you can use consequences to help your teen act responsibly and respectfully.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.home_activity.activity:
Home Activity! Write a list of consequences you can use that are fair. This will prepare you for next time your teen is behaving badly. 

Can you do it today?
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.home_activity.positive_msg: Well done. A fair consequence will help them learn that their actions impact themselves and others. It also teaches them about responsibility and respect! üòÉ
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.home_activity.negative_msg: That‚Äôs okay. The next time your teen misbehaves, try to tell them how you feel in a calm way and give them a fair consequence for their behaviour. You might see it change the way they behave in the future.
Manage My Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.congratulations.msg_list: Amazing work! üéâ You have learnt how to use fair consequences! You have now completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Manage my Teen‚Äôs Behaviour.
